sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using QR decomposition
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations using QR decomposition method:

2x + y - z = 7

-2x - y + 2z = -1

x - 3y + 3z = 3
message_2:
To solve the given system of linear equations using the QR decomposition method, we first need to represent the system in the matrix form Ax = b, where A is the matrix of coefficients, x is the column vector of variables, and b is the column vector of constants.

The given system can be represented as follows:

A = |  2   1  -1 |
    | -2  -1   2 |
    |  1  -3   3 |

x = | x |
    | y |
    | z |

b = |  7  |
    | -1  |
    |  3  |

Now, we need to find the QR decomposition of matrix A, where Q is an orthogonal matrix and R is an upper triangular matrix.

Using the Gram-Schmidt process, we can find the orthogonal basis for the column space of A:

u1 = a1 = (2, -2, 1)
u2 = a2 - proj_u1(a2) = (1, -1, -3) - ((1, -1, -3)·(2, -2, 1))/(||u1||^2) * u1 = (1, -1, -3) - (0, 0, 2) = (1, -1, -5)
u3 = a3 - proj_u1(a3) - proj_u2(a3) = (-1, 2, 3) - ((-1, 2, 3)·(2, -2, 1))/(||u1||^2) * u1 - ((-1, 2, 3)·(1, -1, -5))/(||u2||^2) * u2 = (-1, 2, 3) - (-1, 1, -1/2) - (1/2, -1/2, 1) = (-1/2, 3/2, 9/2)

Now, we normalize the orthogonal basis to obtain the orthonormal basis:

v1 = u1/||u1|| = (2, -2, 1)/3 = (2/3, -2/3, 1/3)
v2 = u2/||u2|| = (1, -1, -5)/√27 = (1/3, -1/3, -√3/3)
v3 = u3/||u3|| = (-1/2, 3/2, 9/2)/√14 = (-1/√14, 3/√14, 9/√14)

Now, we can form the Q and R matrices:

Q = |  2/3   1/3  -1/√14 |
    | -2/3  -1/3   3/√14 |
    |  1/3  -√3/3  9/√14 |

R = | 3  -1  -1/2 |
    | 0  √27  1/2  |
    | 0   0   √14  |

Now, we can solve the system Rx = Q^Tb:

Q^Tb = |  2/3  -2/3   1/3  | |  7  |
       |  1/3  -1/3  -√3/3 | | -1  |
       | -1/√14 3/√14 9/√14 | |  3  |

Q^Tb = | 4 |
       | 2 |
       | 3 |

Now, we have the system:

R = | 3  -1  -1/2 | | x |   |  4  |
    | 0  √27  1/2  | | y | = |  2  |
    | 0   0   √14  | | z |   |  3  |

Solving this system using back-substitution, we get:

z = 3/√14
y = (2 - 1/2 * z)/√27 = (2 - 1/2 * 3/√14)/√27 = (2 - 3/√(14*27))/√27 = (2 - 3/√(14*27)) * √27/√27 = (2√27 - 3√27/√14)/27 = (2√27 - 3√27/√14)/27 = (2 - 3/√14)√27/27
x = (4 + y + 1/2 * z)/3 = (4 + (2 - 3/√14)√27/27 + 3/√14 * 1/2)/3 = (4 + (2 - 3/√14)√27/27 + 3/2√14)/3

So, the solution to the given system of linear equations is:

x ≈ 1.5
y ≈ 0.5
z ≈ 0.8018
